column4: how is it that apt-cache search php5-mcrypt returns package information but apt-get install php5-mcrypt says: E: Package php5-mcrypt has no installation candidate?
run sudo apt-get update; if your issue remains, pastebin full input and output when you attempt to install
!flash | r3m
update was good idea but install still returns the same error
pastebin full input and output when you attempt to install
output is: http://pastebin.com/LwKJL0ee
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list*
pasted at: http://pastebin.com/kcxqk2UC
what is the result of « uname -m »?
it's i686
Linode running Ubuntu Lucid 10.04.3 LTS
one second, that seems strange.  Can you pastebin the output of « sudo apt-get update && apt-cache policy php5-mcrypt »?
I'll do that, hold on.  (yes, seems strange to me too!)
output is:  http://pastebin.com/BbzNPAyf
you have some repositories other than the ones in /etc/apt/sources.list enabled.  They're probably in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/
also, do you have anything in /etc/apt/preferences*?
jrib: yes, the file is mercury.list  The pastebin follows momentarily
files are here: http://pastebin.com/xCiBzym8
why do you have the karmic repos enabled?
this is a Linode stack script called pantheon mercury.  I don't know why Karmic repos are enabled
well there's some sort of attempt to pin the php packages to karmic versions; that's not really supported and is the cause of your problem
okay, I'll inquire of the stack script maintainer.  Thanks.
